item.title: Post your Steam Games
item.dc:creator: Xilefian
item.description:
Skilgannon:

I’d like to make a small request, but don’t want to make an entire thread about it, this seemed the best place. Can someone with Blue Shift please PM me the .ico file? It’s disappeared from my steam/steam/games folder and I can’t find the damn thing on the interwebs. (Yes I’ve googled) It’s irritating me as I have a shortcut on my desktop that had an icon and now no longer does.

It uses the same icon as Half-Life now, so when you restarted your computer it wouldn’t have found the BS icon as it doesn’t exist now.

https://steamcommunity.com/id/xilefian/games?tab=all

Read full topic

item.title: Post your Steam Games
item.dc:creator: Grey_Acumen
item.description:
That’s why unless I absolutely have to play a game right away, I always set myself a cutoff point of paying no more than $5 for any individual game. (though I allowed ten cents extra for Zeno Clash, but only because I had a few extra cents from other games I had gotten that were less than $5 per)

I haven’t strayed from that since I bought Half-Life for $9 last year, which is dismissible since it was a second copy for a friend and I had gotten my own copy for $1.

Wow. I just totaled up all my purchases from steam for my own account and I realized that the total came out to $130. Of course, that also got me almost 40 games, not counting the free mods that Half Life and Orange Box gave me access to.

Torpede:

valve is rich…

also bioshock was overrated, in my opinion. better hold without it. I regret buying mine

for $5, you have little to regret even when purchasing a subpar game.

Read full topic
